utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
(Ross and Rachel enter)

utterances.transcript: Hi!
Hey! So what's the big news you had us rush all the way over here for?
Okay, our news. My company has asked me to head up our office in Tulsa , so as of Monday I'm being officially relocated.
Oh my God!
What?!
What?!
Monday?!
How long do you have to go for?
They said it could be up to a year.
A year?!
Do you have to go?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Monica) Do you have to go?

utterances.transcript: I kind of have to don't I? Because of this stupid thing.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I kind of have to don't I? Because of this stupid thing (Points to her wedding ring.)

utterances.transcript: There is nothing like the support of your loving wife, huh?
Wait a minute, you can't go to Tulsa. Maybe you forgot, but we've got tickets to the Jets game next week.
I'm sorry buddy, but I don't think I'm gonna be able to make it.
We were gonna go see the Jets!
You can't go, I mean you're the glue that holds this group together!
Really?
Not you.
I can't believe you guys are moving.
I call their apartment!!!
No!!! Ah!! Ahh!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: No!!! Ah!! Ahh!!! [INTRO]

plots: Everyone discusses a promotion which may split Monica from her friends and leave Joey less one football buddy .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk]

utterances.transcript: Here you are.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Here you are (Hands Rachel a cup of coffee)

utterances.transcript: Thank you Joey. You know what? I'm not even sure I can have caffeine.
I went thru this with Ben and Carol. One cup of coffee won't affect your milk.
Yeah. Just to be sure I'm gonna call Dr. Wiener.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Laughs)

utterances.transcript: Every time?
utterances.transcript_with_note: Every time? (She takes up her cell phone and starts dialing.)

utterances.transcript: Uhuh.
Rach, you don't have to call whenever you have a little question, okay? Trust me, I know this.
All right, I trust you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: All right, I trust you. (Continues to dial)

utterances.transcript: Rachel, I can see you dialing! I don't understand why...
I'm on the phone! Dr. Wiener?
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm on the phone! (On the phone) Dr. Wiener? (Ross and Rachel walk away)
(Laughs)

utterances.transcript: It's so weird seeing Ross and Rachel with a baby. It's just so grown up.
I know, yeah. I feel like we're all growing up. Person named Wiener, God that kills me.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I know, yeah. I feel like we're all growing up. Person named Wiener, God that kills me. (Laughs)

utterances.transcript: Look at you all grown up.

Actually, you know what? I am. That whole thing with Rachel made me realize that maybe I'm ready for a more serious relationship. You know? Like I'd like to meet a nice mature commitment-minded lady. And looks aren't as important as...Nah, she's gotta be hot.
You know, I might know somebody. Hey, how about you set me up with someone, and we double date!
I can do that, yeah. How is Friday?
Done. Oh good, really?
Yeah!
Let's see! Oh, you know who's great? Sandy Poophack.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Let's see! (Opens her address book.) Oh, you know who's great? Sandy Poophack.

utterances.transcript: Poophack...
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Laughs) Poophack... (Laughs)

utterances.transcript: Yeah... All right, well that rules out Lana Titweiller.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Laughs)

plots: Rachel has anxiety about every little thing concerning her baby , and calls Dr. Weiner .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [SCENE: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

utterances.transcript: Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Enters) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
I've got good news!
You got out of the whole Tulsa thing?
Okay, I have news. You don't have to move to Tulsa. You can stay here and keep your job.
It's great! How? Chandler. Well my boss and I worked out a deal where I only have to be in Tulsa four days a week, so the other three I can be here with you.
So you're gonna be gone four days a week? No.
utterances.transcript_with_note: So you're gonna be gone four days a week? (Thinks about it.) No.

utterances.transcript: I'm sorry, are you just used to saying that?
No. I can't be away from you for that long.
Really?
Yeah, you're my husband. I'm not gonna live in a different state than you for 208 days out of the year.
That's fast math! We could use you in Tulsa.
Honey, thanks for trying to figure out a way, but if you're going to Tulsa, I wanna go with you.
Hey, you said that without gagging!
I know!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I know! (They high-five.)

plots: Chandler and Monica announce their plans to move to Oklahoma .
She decides to take it , so Chandler arranges to spend just 4 days a week in Tulsa .
The decision is made : Monica accepts the job while Chandler agrees to work in Tulsa four days a week and spend the remaining three days in New York .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Ross and Rachel's apartment]

utterances.transcript: Excuse me? Oh yeah? Well, up yours too!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (On the phone) Excuse me? Oh yeah? Well, up yours too! (Hangs up)

utterances.transcript: Who the hell was that?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Enters from his bedroom)Who the hell was that?!

utterances.transcript: Dr. Wiener.
Rach, you can't call people at three in the morning.
Oh you know what, you sound just like his wife!
Was there anything you did wrong with Emma?
Yes, of course there is! Okay? I'm not insane!
Well, what was it?
Hiccups.
Rach, I told you, you can't call him every time any little thing comes up.

Yeah well, not anymore I can't. He fired us! What are we gonna do? We have to find a pediatrician. Wait wait, Monica said that when you guys were growing up, you really liked your doctor. What was his name?
Dr. Gettleman? Yeah I know, I don't think that's a good idea. In fact, I think he's dead.
Argh! Why does everything happen to me?!
Rach, I promise first thing tomorrow we'll find another doctor, but I gotta get up early and I'm not feeling all that well.
What? What, do you mean you're not feeling well? What do you have? Is it Rubella? Because don't go near Emma, she has not had that shot.
You know? Come to think of it, it does feel Rubella-like!
utterances.transcript_with_note: You know? Come to think of it, it does feel Rubella-like! (Walks back into his room.)

utterances.transcript: Wiener, Wiener Wiener, Wiener!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Grabs the phone and stars dialing) (On phone) (In a high pitch voice) Wiener, Wiener (In a low pitch voice) Wiener, Wiener!!!

utterances.transcript: Rachel!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Comes back into the living room) Rachel!!!

utterances.transcript: Great! Now he's gonna know it was me!

plots: Joey ca n't get over the fact that Emma 's pediatrician is named Dr. Weiner .
Ross informs Rachel that Ross had a great pediatrician ( who is now dead ) as a child , but Monica later claims that he is still alive .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Joey's apartment]

utterances.transcript: Hey!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Enters) Hey!

utterances.transcript: Hey!
So how is this for our big double date tonight?
utterances.transcript_with_note: So how is this for our big double date tonight? (She is all dressed up)

utterances.transcript: Oh my God!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Realizes that he has forgotten all about the double date) Oh my God!

utterances.transcript: Ooh, great! Just the reaction I was hoping for.
Yeah, so you found someone for me. You didn't forget?
Of course not! And you're gonna love Mary Ellen. She's really smart and cute and funny, and I can't tell you how I know this, but she' not opposed to threesomes. So tell me some about my guy.
No.
Come on, give me something. What's his name?
Mike.
Mike? Okay! What's his last name?
Damnit! Is there no mystery left in romance anymore!?
All right, we'll se you and Mike at the restaurant in a couple hours.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Ad-lib good-byes) (Phoebe leaves)

utterances.transcript: Why did I have to say Mike? I don't know a Mike! Why couldn't I have said... There's no guy in there!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Why did I have to say Mike? I don't know a Mike! Why couldn't I have said... (Looks through his address book) There's no guy in there!

plots: Joey and Phoebe agree to find dates for each other and double date together .
On the night of the date , Joey has forgotten all about the deal , while Phoebe has already fixed up a woman for Joey .
Eventually , Phoebe discovers the truth and storms out of the date .
Later , Mike admits to having a good time on the date and asks Phoebe for a second one , to which Phoebe agrees .
Phoebe has arranged for Phoebe 's friend Mary Ellen to attend a double date .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

utterances.transcript: It's impossible to find a good doctor. I mean, how do you know the good ones from the ones who are gonna push their penis against your knee?
Excuse me?
I know what she's talking about.
We've got to find a new pediatrician. Ross was getting sick last night, and I think Emma may have caught it.
Why don't you go see Dr. Gettleman?
Ross said he died.
He didn't die. I saw his daughter last week. Said he was fine. Her on the other hand, botched Botox.
Oh, great! Well, then I'm gonna take Emma to see him. I wonder why Ross said that he died.
Oh, maybe he was getting him confused with his childhood therapist.
He saw a therapist?
Yeah, he used to have this recurring nightmare, just really freaked him out.
Why? What was it?
That I was going to eat him.

plots: Emma , Rachel 's daughter is sick and in need of a pediatrician . Monica suggest Ross 's old pediatrician , which Ross claimed was dead , only to find out that the pediatrician is n't dead and Ross still goes to see him .
Ross said Dr. Gettleman died .
Ross had dreams that Ross would be eaten by Monica .
Rachel and Chandler talk about finding a good doctor .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk]
(Joey walks in and looks around. He's trying to find a Mike for Phoebe)

utterances.transcript: MIKE!!!
Yeah?
Okay!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Checks him out) Okay! (Walks over to his table and sits down with him)

plots: Joey is looking for Mike when entering Central Perk , shouts his name , and sits down with him .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Restaurant]

utterances.transcript: I gotta tell you, I can't believe I'm doing this with you. Although I did just get out of a nine-year relationship, so I guess I should be open and taking some risks.
Everything is gonna be fine. Just follow my lead, okay? All you have to do is pretend to be Mike.
I am Mike.
Atta boy!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Atta boy! (Phoebe and Mary Ellen enter.)

utterances.transcript: Okay, look...

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Ad-lib hellos)

utterances.transcript: Joey, this is Mary Ellen Jenkins. So, Mike, how do you and Joey know each other anyway?
How do I and Joey know each other? Wow, if I had a nickel for every time somebody has asked me that.
From school.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Laughs) From school.

utterances.transcript: Yeah, we met in college. I mean, high school.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Yeah, we met in college. (Off Joey's look) I mean, high school.

utterances.transcript: Wow, you guys go way back then. So what are you up to these days?
Well, I'm a lawyer.
Mike, 'attorney at law'!
Actually, I just gave up my practice.
What? That's the kinda thing you usually run by me.
I always wanted to play piano professionally, and I figured if I don't do this now, I never will.
Wow, that's great! I liked that better than the law thing, so...
Which is why I waited until now to introduce you to Mike.
I thought you thought he was still a lawyer.
No, no, that's not what I meant. Let's get you a cocktail.

plots: Phoebe and Mary ellen are scammed by two scum bags .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]
(Monica Enters. Chandler is in the kitchen with his laptop)

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Hey!
What are you doing?
Looking for restaurant jobs for you in Tulsa.
That's so sweet. Find anything?
Slim Pickings.
Nothing, huh?
No, 'Slim Pickings', it's a barbecue restaurant. They're looking for a cook. Actually 'cook' may be a bit of a stretch. They're looking for someone to shovel mesquite.
'Slim Pickings'...That is so cheesy.
'So Cheesy' also has an opening.
Honey, that's okay. I actually know this woman, Nancy, who's a restaurant biz head-hunter. Maybe she'll know of something.

Can I just say how much I appreciate you coming with me. When we get to Tulsa I'm taking you for a great dinner at 'Slim Pickings'. 'So Cheesy'? 'Whole Hog'? It's going to be tough to keep Kosher in Tulsa.

Hi, Nancy. Hi, it's Monica Geller. I'm good. Listen, I'm looking for a job in Tulsa. Well yeah, my husband has been relocated...Because I love him! No, I don't want a job in New York. Javo is looking? Oh my God! He asked for me personally? Oh my God! Oh, wow, this is really flattering, but I'm moving to Tulsa. Yeah, so if you would tell Javo 'I'll take it!'
utterances.transcript_with_note: (On phone) Hi, Nancy. Hi, it's Monica Geller. I'm good. Listen, I'm looking for a job in Tulsa. Well yeah, my husband has been relocated...Because I love him! No, I don't want a job in New York. Javo (sp?) is looking? Oh my God! He asked for me personally? Oh my God! Oh, wow, this is really flattering, but I'm moving to Tulsa. Yeah, so if you would tell Javo (sp?) 'I'll take it!'

plots: Monica contacts a restaurant head - hunter to see if there 's a chef position in Tulsa , and ends up getting a great offer for a position in New York .
Chandler is helping Monica search for jobs in Tulsa , where Chandler has been relocated for work .

After hearing Chandler 's suggestions for chef jobs in Tulsa , Monica calls her friend Nancy , who is a head hunter . Nancy mentions a position for a great restaurant in NY , which Monica spontaneously accepts despite Chandler 's relocation .
Chandler is looking for a restaurant job in tulsa , and each silly statement that Chandler responds to is actually the name of a restaurant .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Pediatrician's office]

utterances.transcript: Hi, my name is Rachel Green, I have an appointment for Emma.
Dr. Gettleman is finishing up with a patient, he should be out shortly.
I think you just have a cold, it's definitely not Strep.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To a patient) I think you just have a cold, it's definitely not Strep.

utterances.transcript: Thanks doctor.
Would you like a lollypop?
You even have to ask?! He is alive!
utterances.transcript_with_note: You even have to ask?! (He grabs a lollypop out of a jar) (Sees Rachel) (To Rachel) He is alive!

plots: Emma has a doctor 's appointment and Emma and Emma 's mom run into Ross .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Restaurant]

utterances.transcript: You know, it's so surprising that you and Joey have known each other for so long and I've never heard about you.
Yeah, that's because we had a bit of a falling out. Mike hit my mom with a car.
No, I didn't.
That's okay Mike, I have forgiven you. And now we're friends again everything's great! Mary Ellen Wait, is your mom okay?
Please, we're trying to have a conversation.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Please, we're trying to have a conversation. (Pushes the wine glass closer to Mary Ellen.)

utterances.transcript: Wow, you're a lot nicer on 'Days of Our Lives'.
'Days of Our Lives'! That's why you look so familiar!
What?!
What?!
What?!
Do you not know each other?

Of course we do! Mike is playing a game that we used to play in high school. Yeah, where we pretend we don't know each other. We played all kinds of games. Hey, remember the one where I punch you in the face for not being cool?!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Laughs) Of course we do! Mike is playing a game that we used to play in high school. Yeah, where we pretend we don't know each other. We played all kinds of games. (To Mike) Hey, remember the one where I punch you in the face for not being cool?!

utterances.transcript: Mike, let me ask you something. How many sisters does Joey have?
Six!
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Joey holds up six fingers) Six!

utterances.transcript: What are you doing? I said seven! Argh!!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: What are you doing? I said seven! (Holds up six fingers.) (Realizes his mistake) Argh!!!

utterances.transcript: Joey, why did you set me up with a stranger?
Because I forgot about our date, I'm so sorry.
I'm sorry too. And just to be clear, I didn't hit his mother with a car.
You are unbelievable! I spent so much time finding the perfect girl for you, you know. Mary Ellen is really smart and cute and loose.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Joey) You are unbelievable! I spent so much time finding the perfect girl for you, you know. Mary Ellen is really smart and cute and loose.

utterances.transcript: Hey!
Who are you kidding? You just find some guy off the street for me? Oh God! This is humiliating!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Who are you kidding? (To Joey) You just find some guy off the street for me? Oh God! This is humiliating!

utterances.transcript: Look Phoebe I'm so sorry! Hey, look, if you don't like this guy I can find you a better one. Mike!! Mike!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Look Phoebe I'm so sorry! Hey, look, if you don't like this guy I can find you a better one. (Looks around) Mike!! Mike!!

utterances.transcript: I'm out of here.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I'm out of here (She leaves)

utterances.transcript: It was nice meeting you!
You're leaving too?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Mary Ellen) You're leaving too?

utterances.transcript: I'll stay if you can tell me my name.
Good night!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

utterances.transcript: Honey, we're leaving tomorrow you've still got a lot of packing to do.
You're right. Maybe I shouldn't go.
utterances.transcript_with_note: You're right. (Pause) Maybe I shouldn't go.

utterances.transcript: What?
So Nancy told me about this job at this great restaurant, Javo . It's just a little outside of Tulsa.
utterances.transcript_with_note: So Nancy told me about this job at this great restaurant, Javo (sp?). It's just a little outside of Tulsa.

utterances.transcript: How far outside?
Manhattan.
And you're thinking of taking it? So before you said being me with me was more important than any job, but I guess now it's old job, me, new job.
utterances.transcript_with_note: And you're thinking of taking it? (Pause) So before you said being me with me was more important than any job, but I guess now it's old job, (Raises his hand) me, (Raises his hand) new job.

utterances.transcript: I'm gonna miss this hand! Okay I know it's a lot to ask, but oh my God Chandler, this is a once in a lifetime opportunity.
What happened to 'you can't live without me four days a week'?

Well, if you really think about it, I mean four days is not that long. I mean, I see you Monday before you go to work, and I see you Thursday when you get back, and I always work late on Tuesdays, so really if you think about it, it's really just one day. And well, if we can't make it one day, we've got real problems my friend.
I think you should take the job.
Really?
Yeah. I know it must be important to you when you start chattering like a monkey.
That's the nicest anyone has ever said to me!
utterances.transcript_with_note: That's the nicest anyone has ever said to me! (Ross and Rachel enter with Emma.)

utterances.transcript: Hey!
How was the pediatrician?
Oh, I really liked him. Yeah, it was really, really, really good.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Oh, I really liked him. (Looks at Ross) Yeah, it was really, really, really good.

utterances.transcript: You promised you wouldn't say anything.
I know. Ross still sees his pediatrician!!! I don't care!
utterances.transcript_with_note: I know. (Pause) Ross still sees his pediatrician!!! (To Ross) I don't care!

utterances.transcript: Are you serious? You still see Dr. Gettleman?
He's a brilliant diagnostician!
Diagnostician or boo-boo fixer?
Ross, seriously! You've gotta go to an appropriate doctor.
Why? Why? I know it's a little weird, but hey, he's a great doctor, okay? He knows my medical history, and every time I go in there, he makes a big deal. 'Ah look, it's my favorite patient!'
Does he say that before he sticks his thermometer in your touchy?
Hey, I seem to remember someone bringing his security blanket to college!
That was not a security blanket! That was a wall-hanging!
It didn't spend much time on the wall!!!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Central Perk]

utterances.transcript: Excuse me, hi. I was hoping I would run into you. Can we talk?
Sure.
I'm sorry, really, I'm so embarrassed. Really, I'm a pretty nice guy. Just ask my parole officer...Apparently I'm not a funny guy.
Why did you go along with that?
Because I was told I'd get a free dinner, which I didn't. And that I'd meet a pretty girl. Which I did.
That's true. Well, is anything you told me about yourself true?
utterances.transcript_with_note: That's true. (Pause) Well, is anything you told me about yourself true?

utterances.transcript: My name in Mike, and I do play piano.
Prove it.
There isn't a piano here.
That wouldn't stand in the way of a true pianist.

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Plays 'air piano')

utterances.transcript: You are really good! I play a little guitar myself.
Really?
Uhuh.
That's great. What kind of music do you play?
Well, like acoustic folksy stuff. You know? But right now I'm working on a couple 'Iron Maiden' covers.
Do you think that maybe, sometime, I could...
It's okay. Go ahead, ask me out.
Okay. Do you think maybe sometime I could take you out?

utterances.transcript_with_note: (Walks In)

utterances.transcript: Oh, you just caught me off guard! Yeah, that would be nice.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Mike) Oh, you just caught me off guard! Yeah, that would be nice.

utterances.transcript: Look at this. My two best friends!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Look at this. My two best friends! (Phoebe and Mike look at him, and he goes over to the counter.)

plots: Phoebe finds out the truth and leaves , but later Mike finds Phoebe at the coffee house and they arrange to go out again .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Pediatrician's office]

utterances.transcript: Excuse me, I don't mean to be a jerk, but the baby with the rash came in after me.
The doctor will be right with you sir.
Mommy, I can't find Waldo.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Reading a book) Mommy, I can't find Waldo.

utterances.transcript: With the circus? He's behind the elephant.
Wow, so your child is a big fan of the Waldo books too?
Yeah, that's how I know. I'm Ross by the way.
Hi, I'm Sally. So, no ring. Can I assume you are also a single parent?
I am a single parent.
It's hard isn't it? There's almost no time for a social life. I mean, where are you gonna meet someone?
Well, let's say, I don't know, you met someone in the pediatrician's office.
Rossy, we're ready for you.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (To Ross) Rossy, we're ready for you.

utterances.transcript: Hmm, yeah. Come on Ross jr. It's time to go in.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Hmm, yeah. (To a random boy in the waiting room) Come on Ross jr. It's time to go in.

utterances.transcript: Mommy.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Mommy (He walks over to Sally.)

utterances.transcript: Mommy, what's wrong with that man?
Hey, I helped you find Waldo!

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment]

utterances.transcript: Oh good, you haven't left yet.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Enters) Oh good, you haven't left yet.

utterances.transcript: Where have you been?
I got held up at Dr. Gettleman's office. There was some guy that freaked everybody out.
Well, you got here just in time. I really have to go buddy.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Well, you got here just in time. I really have to go buddy. (They hug)

utterances.transcript: Oh man.
Promise to call me when you land.
Of course I will call you. I love you.
I love you too.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I love you too. (They kiss)

utterances.transcript: Okay, wow, wow, wow. Watch the tongue people, we've got a baby over here.
Bye Chandler.
Awww. Bye!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Awww. (They hug) Bye!

utterances.transcript: Bye honey.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Bye honey. (They hug)

utterances.transcript: What's the matter Joe?
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Tries to hug Joey but J. moves away) What's the matter Joe?

utterances.transcript: I'm mad at you for leaving! You're nothing but a big leaver. Big leaver with a stupid suitcase.
Any chance you are trying to pick a fight to make all this easier?
Dude, you see right thru me!!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Dude, you see right thru me!! (They hug) (Joey heads for the door and pushes Chandler's suitcase on the way out.)

utterances.transcript: Well, bye Mon, bye Ross, Rachel, bye Emma!
Okay, bye-bye! Good trip!
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, bye-bye! (Pushes Chandler out the door.) Good trip! (Slams the door)

utterances.transcript: Chandler, wait. It goes: Old job, new job, you. This is just something I have to do.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (Runs out to the hallway) Chandler, wait. It goes: Old job, (Raises her hand) new job, (Raises her hand really high) you. This is just something I have to do.

utterances.transcript: I know.
I love you so much.
I know that too.
utterances.transcript_with_note: I know that too. (They kiss) (Joey opens the door and takes Chandler's suitcase into his own apartment.)

plots: Monica and two her friends said good bye to someone .

utterances.transcript_with_note: [Scene: Airport]

utterances.transcript: Don't worry, I'll be back before you know it. Yes it will be the same. Because I know, that's how. I promise.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (On cell phone) Don't worry, I'll be back before you know it. Yes it will be the same. Because I know, that's how. I promise.
Cut to Monica and Chandler's apartment.

utterances.transcript: Double promise? Call me when you land.
utterances.transcript_with_note: (On the phone with Chandler) Double promise? Call me when you land.

utterances.transcript: Can I talk now?
Okay, bye.
utterances.transcript_with_note: Okay, bye. (He hangs up the phone.)

utterances.transcript: Joey?
He had to board.
